fields.description:
When creating a branch from a feature in jira, I want to choose if its a new feature or a hotfix.

Feature should be the default. 

If it's a feature then the "branch from" should be set to develop

And the branch name should be prefixed with feature\

if it's a hotfix then the "branch from" should be set to master

And the branch name should be prefixed with hotfix\
fields.summary: As a user, I want to create branches that map to the gitflow workflow.

fields.description: Can Administrators have the ability to edit Full Name. This defaulting to the email address is not good. We have many overseas users with very long names (sometimes 12-14 characters in both first and surnames each!) and we wish to keep to the old standard.
fields.summary: Full name

fields.description:
Hello,

We, at Bizongo, are using JIRA to manage our Projects and for tracking Bugs. And also, we are using JIRA for taking feedback from our operations and sales team, in case they need anything from the engineering team on an immediate basis. We have setup a widget from where admin users can provide feedback and JIRA ticket is raised. 

We have setup a widget from where admin users can provide feedback and JIRA ticket is raised and hence, making sure we are tracking the issues. But whenever we need more information from admin user or telling them whether the issue is resolved, we can not do that. There is no two-way communication happening. 

We want to keep the information internal to our organization and don't want to keep public. and also, creating JIRA account for every user in the organization also does not make sense as most of them do not use this as a task management tool.

Can you please help me out and let me know in any way JIRA can help us set up a structure where we can take feedback from external teams and still making sure two-way communication happens through JIRA.

Regards

Shashank Sharma
fields.summary: Taking feedback from our Admin Support team

fields.description:
Old JIRA
 !Screen Shot 2017-09-11 at 15.06.18.png|thumbnail!

New JIRA
!Screen Shot 2017-09-11 at 14.55.51.png|thumbnail! 


Because of this now I need to scroll down to see issue Description.

In old JIRA there was also an ability to collapse Details section, and this was preserved when browsing other issues - I haven't found this ability in new JIRA
fields.summary: New Jira design: details section is taking too much space, no way to collapse it

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users are encountering permission errors when accessing a board while the board administrator can access the board just fine.

Error : The requested board cannot be viewed because it either does not exist or you do not have permission to view it

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Access a JIRA Software board

h3. Expected Results

The board should be accessible if the user has the proper project permissions and permissions to view the board filter.

h3. Actual Results

Error encountered :

The requested board cannot be viewed because it either does not exist or you do not have permission to view it

h3. Fix

The issue is caused by board location being set to *None*. As the administrator of the board 

- Open the board
- Access the board settings
- Set the Board Location to the project specified in the filter.
fields.summary: Board permission error when board location is set to None

fields.description:
h3. Summary

_Internal Server Error_ shown when user attempt to change Board location and select current user.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Have a board (ie Scrum)
# Attempt to change the board location to Current User

h3. Actual Result

_Internal Server Error_ shown and the changes isn't saved.

h3. Expected Result

- No error is shown and changes are saved.
fields.summary: Unable to select board location to user

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Time Tracking gadget shows the sum of the Original and Remaining Time estimate.
The board shows the *Remaining Sum* field (where the remaining sum is sum up to parent)
It is important that there is consistency in showing the information for this fields. 

h3. Environment
Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Task
# Create subtasks
# Estimate the subtasks
# Check the *Include Subtask* in the Time Tracking gadget on the Task

h3. Expected Results
*Original Time Estimate* and *Remaining Time Estimate* fields have the same value on the board backlog and in the Time Tracking gadget. 

h3. Actual Results
* *Original Time Estimate* and *Remaining Time Estimate* show the sum in the Time Tracking gadget. 
**  !Time Tracking gadget.png|thumbnail!  
* *Original Time Estimate* and *Remaining Time Estimate* show no value on the board Backlog. The issue is not estimated. 
**  !Board showing estimation.png|thumbnail!  


h3.Workaround
-
fields.summary: Have consistency for the Original and Remaining Time estimate fields on Time Tracking gadget and the Board backlog

fields.description:
(Duplicating the other ticket. The icon isn't horrible, but it could be improved through this.)

 

Current version of Bitbucket Server only use favicon. Unfortunately Apple choose <link rel="mask-icon" ...> for icon rendered inside pinned tabs.

Please add proper configuration for this into JIRA (cloud if possible and server) similar to favicon configuration.

Related info:
[https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/AppleApplications/Reference/SafariWebContent/pinnedTabs/pinnedTabs.html]
fields.summary: Add mask-icon for Safari Pinned Tab icon

fields.description: In the document [Managing project permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/managing-project-permissions-776636362.html] is not clear how the "Schedule issues" permission affects issues ranking on JIRA boards. Actually, this permission needs a better explanation on this document
fields.summary: As a project administrator, I want a better explanation how "Schedule issues" permission affects issues ranking on boards

fields.description:
Currently in JIRA Cloud is isn't possible to change what appears in the 'Issues in Epic' panel in an epic screen.

The columns shown are the issue reference, issue summary, issue type and status.

I would like to be able to see other information in this screen, such as time tracking information (estimated & remaining) and other fields that can be filtered on.
fields.summary: Add facility to change what is displayed in the 'Issues in Epic' panel

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, users cannot see all the Sprints a JIRA issue have been part of when checking the detail issue view, since completed Sprints do not appear on it anymore.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the user the ability to chose whether he wants to show completed ones or not under the JIRA Software configuration.

h3. Workaround 
NONE.
fields.summary: Provide the ability for customers to show all previously completed Sprints in the Sprint field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When users create an issue using inline issue creation in Backlog of Kanban board, it doesn't get automatically added to the Epic/Component.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a kanban board in a new project.
# Change the board filter so that it specifies {{fixVersion != EMPTY AND component != EMPTY}}
#  Create a version and a component for the project.
# Create quick filters which specify fixVersion and component, using the version and component from step 3.
# Apply the quick filters and create an issue inline in the backlog.

h3. Actual Result

The issue is created with the specified fixVersion and component.

h3. Expected Result
The issue is created with no fixVersion and no component.

h3. Workaround
Remove the (fixVersion != EMPTY) clause and the (component != EMPTY) clause from the board's filter.
fields.summary: Issue are not added to an Epic/Component automatically in Inline Issue Creation

fields.description:
I am a JIRA administrator and can create JIRA users in our instance. However I am unable to do this as I cannot see the username field in the Create User screen.

!image-2017-09-04-10-58-57-546.png!
fields.summary: Unable to create JIRA user. Error encountered

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Hyphen used in issue key in JIRA Software board (Active Sprint/Kanban board View) seems to use different unicode causing users not able to search for certain issue.
 
h3. Steps to reproduce

# Have a Scrum/Kanban board and some issues
# Go to Active Sprint/Kanban board view
# Press {{ctrl+f}} and key in the issue key (ie. ABC-1)
#* Searching only the project key works (/)
#*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
#* Searching project key plus (dash) (x)
#*  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Browser

Chrome Version 60.0.3112.113 (Official Build) (64-bit)

h3. Actual Result

Issue isn't searchable using normal dash ( - )

h3. Expected Result

Issues should be searchable using normal dash ( - )
fields.summary: Hyphen used in issue key seems to use different unicode

fields.description:
Mobile teams are often confronted to this problem.

They create a user story for a given feature.

Then they realize it's going to be implemented on iOS, Android and Windows Phone.

They duplicate the ticket.

I suggest that they should not have to.

There should be a way of tracking Multi-platform implementation of a user story without having to duplicate the ticket for each platform.

This could come in the form of platform switch links within the ticket or other form of controls.

The description would be the same. The tracking info would be platform specific.

There would also be common attached files and platform specific attached files.
fields.summary: Multi-plaform JIRA tickets

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Boards don't show accurate information for epics and sprints.
Example:
- Epic show as {{unlabelled}}
- Issue is moved to sprint but still shown on backlog
- Card layout doesn't show Epic
- Epic panel doesn't show the correct amount of issues on each Epic
- Rank issue doesn't work
- Epic Color is not shown

h3. Environment
* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Move issue from backlog to sprint
# Refresh the board page and the change won't be reflected
OR
# Move issue to a Epic
# Refresh the board page and the change won't be reflected

h3. Expected Results
The issue is updated and the changes are reflected on board.

h3. Actual Results
The issue is updated but the changes aren't reflected on board.
 
h3. Notes
* 

h3.Workaround
# Create a copy of the affected project's field configuration
# Create a new field configuration scheme
# Add the field configuration created on step 1 to the scheme created on step 2
# Associate the project to the new scheme
fields.summary: Boards intermittently don't show updated information

fields.description:
When assigning the case/issue back to someone, I click "Assign", but then I can't see the previous comment/description
 Enhancement would be either 
1) make that overlay window movable
2) make the content that I type savable so I can come back again after reading the comments/description
3) in that overlay window, also shows the previous comments entered by client
fields.summary: Can't see the previous comment/description

fields.description: The Developer role shows up on the People page when you install both JSD & JSW, but there's no indication as to what it is in either the documentation or the UI, even at the Admin level. Please update the UI to say where it comes from & what it does, and also mention it in the docs.
fields.summary: please document the Developer role

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On a multiple project board, the backlog and active sprint link will be missing on the board location if the user does not have browse access permission on all the projects in the board filter.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Create a board using filter = {{Project in (ProjA, ProjB)}}
- Set the board location to ProjC
- Grant browse project access to a User on ProjA and ProjC
- Share the board filter to the User
- As User, access the board location or the direct link to the board.

h3. Expected Results

Backlog and Active Sprint links should be visible.


h3. Actual Results

The backlog and active sprint links are missing on the project sidebar.

 !direct link to project.png|thumbnail! 

Accessing the URL of the board will show the board but the the backlog and active sprint links are still missing on the sidebar.

 !direct link to board.png|thumbnail! 


 
h3. Notes

When the User opens the filter manually, an error message will be returned because the User does not have browse project permission on ProjB.

h3.Workaround

Disable the new JIRA Experience and access the board link directly.

- Avatar -> New Jira Experience : Turn off for now
- Open the board from the Boards Menu.
fields.summary: Missing backlog and sprint link on board location project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there isn't an option to automatically fill in the Issue Link field when creating multiple issues using the option 'Create another'.

h3. Suggested Solution

Leave the Issue Link fields already filled in when bringing up a new Create Issue pane through the Create Another option, the same way as it's available for Epic Links.
fields.summary: Automatically fill in the Issue Link field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Time Tracking gadget shows the sum of the Original and Remaining Time estimate.
The board shows the *Remaining Sum* field (where the remaining sum is sum up to parent)
It is important that there is consistency in showing the information for this fields. 

h3. Environment
Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Task
# Create subtasks
# Estimate the subtasks
# Check the *Include Subtask* in the Time Tracking gadget on the Task

h3. Expected Results
*Original Time Estimate* and *Remaining Time Estimate* fields have the same value on the board backlog and in the Time Tracking gadget. 

h3. Actual Results
* *Original Time Estimate* and *Remaining Time Estimate* show the sum in the Time Tracking gadget. 
**  !Time Tracking gadget.png|thumbnail!  
* *Original Time Estimate* and *Remaining Time Estimate* show no value on the board Backlog. The issue is not estimated. 
**  !Board showing estimation.png|thumbnail!  


h3.Workaround
-
fields.summary: There isn't consistency for the Original and Remaining Time estimate fields on Time Tracking gadget and the Board backlog

fields.description:
The feedback system is occasionally broken.

Experience #1

Eternal spinning dark gray loading circle, and unable to cancel without refreshing page.

Experience #2

Dialog opens, but only name and email field is visible. See attachment, showing what happens when attempting to post nothing.

Expected:

Both body- , name-, and email fields.

Suspicion:

I had already sent a feedback, earlier today. Is the body field hidden for the rest of the session, perhaps?
fields.summary: Fix the "Help us improve JIRA" dialog, for quick feedback from users

fields.description:
The field below the issues in the backlog is a handy way to add issues quickly.

Sometimes, it is experienced, that clicking the '+ Create issue' causes a blink, but then nothing happens, and the user is unable to add issue this way.

Workaround:

Refresh page.
fields.summary: Create issue quick insert doesn't always work

fields.description:
Current project key is stored in session. If multiple boards are open in browser tabs, pressing "Create epic" selects the latest visited project in the top dropdown, instead of the one currently in. This causes confusion and misplaced epics.

Suggestion:

Add project key to "Create epic" link.
fields.summary: Epic registration using multiple tabs leads to misplaced epics.

fields.description:
If two boards point to the same project, entering that project using the project key opens one of the boards based on some priority.

If navigating to and from the "releases" section, the rapidView id is lost, and you potentially jump to a different board in the set, when going back to backlog or active sprint.

I know that a project link cannot know of which board it "belongs", boards are considered equal, but still, if a board is selected, it should stick to it during navigation, and not switch unnoticed.
fields.summary: Include rapidView in all links, to prevent switching boards when multiple boards point to the same project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

General error message shown when Business project type selected as Board location. 

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Make sure JIRA has the new design
# Access a board that has empty location
# It will prompt users to select the project for board location
# Select any business project type

h3, Actual Result

It shows general error message and it's really confusing users.
-  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Result

Show the proper message that only Software project type can be select.

h3. Notes

In the old design, the board location is not enforced hence users can still access the board without having to select a project. In new design, users must select Software type project before they can view the board. However, if the issues are from Business type project, users will need to convert the project type to Software project first.
fields.summary: General error message shown when Business project type selected as Board location in new design

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Boards are disconnected from projects when the filter associated produces an invalid query.

h3. Environment
Cloud latest version

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board based in JQL with status, for example.
# Remove one of the statuses in the query from the instance, producing an invalid query.

h3. Expected Results
The board should load or show the user a message saying the filter needs to be fixed.

h3. Actual Results
The board loads and no errors occur, but the board is not connected with the project that it should be.
No backlog of Active Sprints tab appear in the project sidebar.
 
h3.Workaround
Change the filter to another one with a fixed JQL.
fields.summary: Boards are disconnected from projects when the filter associated is not a valid JQL in Old JIRA Experience

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A search query that uses the development field, e.g. {{development[commits].all > 0}}, cannot be saved as a filter. This is because when you do it the query gets changed in the saved and double quotes are added around".all".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In JIRA, go to *Issues* > *Search for issues*
 # Enter {{development[commits].all > 0}} as the search query. Run it, see that it works fine (assuming you have a linked BB or Github repository and that you have some issues with some information in the development panel):
 # Save the query as a filter
!development-commits.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The saved filter works fine
h3. Actual Results

The search query is changed into {{development[commits]."all" > 0}} and the error: "Error in the JQL Query: Expecting a property id but got '.'. (line 1, character 21)" is returned:
 !development-filter-save.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

When running step #2 you can see that you have the search query added to the url (as shown in below example) and you can save it as a bookmark in your Internet browser:
 - [https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/issues/?jql=development%5Bcommits%5D.all%20%3E%200|https://instance.atlassian.net/issues/?jql=development%5Bcommits%5D.all%20%3E%200]
fields.summary: Search queries using the development field cannot be saved as a filter

fields.description:
I would like to know if it is possible to use calendars to manage task times in Jira.

For example:

 Our tasks last for different times each one of them, and we would have to use a calendar to view in a timeline all of them.Is it posible?

 THnx
fields.summary: Use of calendars
As a JIRA user, I want a button to Create boards in New JIRA Experience, similar to the button of the JIRA "old" layout

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Sprint Health Gadget does not show data for next due Sprint when JIRA is in Spanish.

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud - latest version

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board with a Sprint.
# Change your language to Spanish
# Create a dashboard with the Sprint health gadget on it.

h3. Expected Results
The Next due Sprint should show up in the gadget.

h3. Actual Results
A message saying:
"La pizarra solicitada no se puede ver porque no existe o usted no tiene permiso para verla." 
"The requested board cannot be viewed because it either does not exist or you do not have permission to view it."
appears and the user can't see the gadget information.

h3.Workaround
# Manually selecting the next Sprint will make it work.
# Modify the language of your JIRA to english.
fields.summary: JIRA Sprint Health Gadget does not show data for next due Sprint

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

It is not currently possible to export some data (ie.Cycle Time) from Control Chart for each team member. Getting this data will require manual work which takes extra efffort.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to export Cycle time in Control Chart for each team member
fields.summary: A feature to export Cycle time in Control Chart for each team member

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Board settings cannot be accessed and there's a non-stopping spinning wheel that appears.
This problem is caused by unavailable statuses in the Workflow of the projects related with this board that are being used in columns.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board with a project on it.
# Make sure you have a column holding a single status of the workflow on it.
# Manage the workflow in this project being used by this board and remove one of the statuses being used in a column.

h3. Expected Results
When you enter the board, the status appears with a "warning" icon on it, saying it's not a valid status anymore.

h3. Actual Results
The board never loads.
The following appears in console:
{code}
Request URL:https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidviewconfig/editmodel.json?rapidViewId=<ID>&_=<ID>
Request Method:GET
Status Code:400 
Remote Address:104.192.138.35:443
Referrer Policy:no-referrer-when-downgrade
{code} 

h3.Workaround
The workaround involves putting all the removed workflow status back into the Workflow, publishing it, accessing the board and removing the status that will be deleted.
fields.summary: Board settings cannot be accessed (non-stopping spinning wheel of death)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users are encountering permission error to access a board. This happens when a user browse project permission to a subset of the projects in the board filter but they do not have access the project where the board location is set.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Create a filter that includes multiple projects.  {{Project in (ProjA,ProjB,ProjC,ProjD)}}
- Configure a board to use that filter.
- Grant permission to a user on ProjA only
- Set the location of the Board to ProjB
- As the user, access the board.

h3. Expected Results

User should be able to view the board containing only the issues for ProjA.

h3. Actual Results

The board will load with a permission error. 

 !board error.png|thumbnail! 

{{Error : The requested board cannot be viewed because it either does not exist or you do not have permission to view it}}

h3.Workaround

*Option 1* : Ignore the error and the board should load but the user needs to access the URL manually to navigate between the Active Sprint and Backlog.

Backlog : {{https://<cloud_instance>.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=<BoardNumber>&view=planning.nodetail}}
Active Sprints : {{https://<cloud_instance>.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=<BoardNumber>}}

*Option 2* : Grant *Browse Project* permission to the user for the project configured as the location of the board.
fields.summary: Permission error if the user has no access on the board location.

fields.description:
Please, help to solve a problem:

Expected Result:
Logged time of the user in Tempo is displayed correctly.

Actual Result:
can not see logged time for the user, while all other members are visible normally. For one user name is shown with "?" in the beginning of the username (not full name).  

The user profile is checked and everything seems okay, except, the user is not added by default to holiday scheme as other users. Maybe something wrong with database and needed to be rewritten without losing any information?
fields.summary: Can not see logged time for the user in Tempo, name is shown with "?" in the beginning

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Queries using the Development custom field are not considered valid queries by JIRA JQL assistant.
When used in Bulk Edits, it simply redirects the customer back to the JQL page.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a query like this in the Issue search:
{code}
development[pullrequests].all >= 0
{code}
# Try to bulk Edit the issues

h3. Expected Results
The result of the query should be displayed to the user and the user should be able to Bulk Edit

h3. Actual Results
The results appear to be retrieved correctly, but the Bulk Edit never starts.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Failing to Bulk Edit when using queries based in the Development field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Queries using the Development custom field are not considered valid queries by JIRA JQL assistant.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a query like this in the Issue search:
{code}
development[pullrequests].all > 2
{code}

h3. Expected Results
This is a valid query and JIRA should show the user a green arrow indicating the query is valid.
The result of the query should be displayed to the user.

h3. Actual Results
The results appear to be retrieved correctly, but JIRA is considering this syntax as an invalid syntax:
 !invalidQuery.png|thumbnail! 

h3. NOTES:
Seems to be affecting Bulk Edits based in this query as well.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Queries using the Development custom field are not considered valid queries.
Management

fields.description: It is not possible to set the color or look of the selected item in Kanban board or backlog or sprint. It is impossible to see the light blue color that is default today. On certain monitors and projectors. Make it possible to configure the selected look and feel.
fields.summary: Color of current item

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it's only possible to disable the issue detail view feature instance wide for JIRA Core boards.
!core labs.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a new checkbox that will disable the feature for JIRA Software boards as well (Including Next-gen).

h3. Why this is important

Customers should have the option to disable this for software boards as well.
 
h3. Workaround 
Each user must deactivate the feature on their profile settings to affect the software boards. In Next-gen, this is not an option.
!profile.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Implement a on/off checkbox to disable the board issue details lab feature for JSW boards

fields.description: As a user I would like to be able to add the Control Chart and Cumulative Flow Diagram reports to the Dashboard using a gadget for each one
fields.summary: Add the Control Chart and Cumulative Flow Diagram reports to the Dashboard using a gadget for each one

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Search field in Backlog does not clear value when clicking on the X button that appear after values are inserted.

h3. Customer Impact
* Unable to clear values by clicking on the X button

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Backlog
# Expand field by hovering the mouse cursor over search box and click, Enter value
# Field display X button
# Click the X button, nothing happens

h3. Expected Results
By clicking the X button the value should clear

h3. Actual Results
Value does not clear and nothing happens

h3.Workaround
Clear values by using the Del or Backspace key
fields.summary: Not Able to Click X on Backlog Search Field

fields.description: In the document [Sprint Report|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/sprint-report-777002722.html], we are missing a description of what the section "Issues completed outside of this sprint" is.
fields.summary: As a PO I want a description what the section "Issues completed outside of this sprint" is on Sprint Report documentation

fields.description:
For teams that use smaller sprints (such a few days), it'd be helpful to show those sprints at the same high-level view you'd get from a sprint that has a longer sprint.

For example, in a sprint that lasts the default 10 days, each day will be one mark along the x-axis. When the sprint is only 3 or 4 days, the intervals swap to hourly intervals.

This may cause confusion that the team is working 24/7 when they are not.

For Cloud Customers, [Great Gadgets|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.stonikbyte.great.gadgets.plugin/cloud/overview] can be used to provide greater control over charts.
fields.summary: The interval for the x-Axis in charts (such as burndown charts) should be configurable

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

When an issue has long description, it will be cut off in Card printing. It has been raised here but it's closed as _Won't fix_:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-5900

h3. Suggested Resolution 

Support long description in Card printing feature in board.
fields.summary: Provide support to have long description in Card printing

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
This is now documented in the page: 
- [Advanced searching - developer reference|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-developer-reference-967312910.html]{quote}
You can search for issues based on the your development status:

development[pullrequests].all (or .open) 
development[commits].all
development[reviews].all (or .open)
development[builds].failing


So for example if you wanted to find all your issues that have more than 2 failing builds you would use:

development[builds].failing > 2
{quote}


Review the documentation page for more details.
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

There are many threads on the [Atlassian Community|https://https//community.atlassian.com] explaining how to search for issues having some data in the *development* panel. However there is no clear documentation and some keywords are not working anymore.

E.g. Before it was possible to search for this kind of information by using:
{noformat}
issue.property[development].commits
issue.property[development].prs 
.....
{noformat}
The above search fields are not working in the new infrastructure and the below ones should be used instead:
{noformat}
development[pullrequests].all (or .open) 
development[commits].all
development[reviews].all (or .open)
development[builds].failing
{noformat}
h3. Suggested Solution

Create a documentation page for these fields
h3. Workaround
 # Use a trial/error approach. E.g.:
 !dev-pullrequests.png|thumbnail!
 # Or search the [Atlassian Community|https://https//community.atlassian.com] for threads like the below ones:
 -- [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/JIRA-questions/JQL-quot-issue-property-development-commits-gt-0-quot-not/qaq-p/298377]
 -- [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Answers-Developer-Questions/Get-commits-info-of-a-JIRA-issue-using-REST-API/qaq-p/530323]
fields.summary: There is no documentation explaining how search for issues with existing commits or pull requests or similar.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Development custom fields not displaying information anymore in issue search.
App versions:
Not Working: JIRA Agile v1001.0.0
Working: JIRA Agile v1000.1168.0

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an environment in the designated version (Not working)
# Perform a Smart commit referencing a JIRA Issue.
# Search for this issue in the Issue Search using:
development[commits].all > 0

h3. Expected Results
The issues with at least one comment should appear and the information should be displayed.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
The correct issues are retrieved, they have commits on them, but the commit information does not appear in the issue search:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!  

h3.Workaround
NONE
fields.summary: Development custom fields not displaying information anymore in issue search.

fields.description:
h3. SUMMARY

Epic burndown chart should keep a proper reference of burned stories. Currently, if there's any issue was burned in a certain Epic but moved to other Epic after that, the issue won't be shown in the burndown chart - only the story point.

This cause confusion to why there are more story points than the listed stories.
 !story_points.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. SUGGESTION
Keep moved issues in the report with a remark to point out that the issues no longer under the same Epic.
fields.summary: Epic burndown chart should keep proper reference of burned stories

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the [Epic Burndown report documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/epic-burndown-777002693.html] indicates that for the given Epic only the Sprints the issues of this epic are part of will be shown. 

{quote}
The *first sprint* shown is the one that contains the first issue (in the epic) that transitions out of the 'To Do' status, i.e. work is started on the epic.

The *last sprint* shown is the one when all work is completed for the epic; or if work remains, then the predicted sprint when work will be finished.
{quote}


h3. Suggested Solution

Add an explanation that showing Sprints which don't have issues from the Epic is working as designed. The issue shows up in the sprint time window that it is completed in, rather than the sprint it is assigned to.
fields.summary: Improve Epic Burndown report documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you click to view the "Epic link" custom filed, the error message "Error rendering 'gh-epic-link'. Please contact your JIRA administrators." is displayed.


h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* All

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click Cog icon > Issues
# Under Fields, click Custom fields
# Locate the Epic Link custom field, then click the Cog icon > View

h3. Expected Results

You see the info related to the custom field

h3. Actual Results

You see the error message "Error rendering 'gh-epic-link'. Please contact your JIRA administrators." besides default value

The below exception is thrown in the JIRA log file:

{noformat}
2017-08-01 19:43:34.321400500 2017-08-01 19:43:34,321 http-nio-3008-exec-4 WARN 557058:c86baf45-5b5f-4136-831a-931e11ac0970 1183x2306x1  201.22.212.136 /secure/admin/ConfigureCustomField!default.jspa [c.atlassian.ozymandias.SafePluginPointAccess] Unable to run plugin code because of 'java.lang.NullPointerException - null'.
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
fields.summary: "Error rendering 'gh-epic-link'. Please contact your JIRA administrators" error message in Epic link custom field view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Workload by Assignee does not show the correct remaining time for subtasks. It sums up the Remaining Time estimate to the assignee of the parent task instead of to the actual assignees.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create issue 1 (estimate it 1h) and issue 2 (estimate it 1h)
 # Create subtask of issue 1 (estimate it 30min)
 # Add the issues to a Sprint
 # Assign the issue 1 to user A and issue 2 to user B
 # Assign the subtask of issue 1 to assignee B

h3. Expected Results

The remaining time estimate should show 1h 30minutes for the assignee B
h3. Actual Results

The remaining time estimate shows 1h 30minutes for the assignee A
 * !Workload by assignee remaining time.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

No workaround available
fields.summary: The Workload by Assignee shows the remaining time for subtasks as a sum in the parent task instead of to the assignee

Something has gone wrong

If you're still seeing this screen after ten minutes please raise a support request.

fields.description:
Add a Planning Poker link to the JIRA ticket page
 
This will allow teams to start a planning poker session for a given user story directly from within its ticket. The new planning poker page will behave like the site http://www.planitpoker.com. When voting is over, the story points will be filled into the JIRA ticket.
fields.summary: Add Planning Poker functionality

fields.description:
Hello Team,

We would like to know is there a way to integrate JIRA with our ERP system - SAP Business one? What do we need to do in order to integrate them?

 

Kind Regards,

Support team
fields.summary: Integration with ERP

fields.description:
The page you linked shows:
"Navigate to the desired board, then select more ( ... ) > Board settings"
(src [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/configuring-estimation-and-tracking-764478030.html])

I couldn't find the text 'more' with ctrl+f, but did accidentally notice the '...' on the top right of the page.


Would it make sense to update the description of the '...' menu to describe the location?


From a UI perspective, almost all of the project-specific menus are on the left of the page, and tend to have text associated with them.


Therefore, I feel that having three dots on the top right is a bit counter-intuitive and difficult to locate.
fields.summary: Change the menu more (...) for something more intuitive on the Boards

fields.description: Possibility to show in issue list the issue Link Type wiki page in JIRA Cloud. Only the epic links are shown
fields.summary: Filter issues by link type "wiki page"
Ability to change text color in body of CODE or PANEL block

fields.description:
I was running through the following documentation for getting SSL working on JIRA 7.3 and noticed that in the section "Configuring your web server using the JIRA configuration tool" for Linux the "config.sh" edits the "conf/server.xml" file but incorrectly references a class name "*org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol*" for the "protocol".  I believe it should be "*org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11{color:#FF0000}Nio{color}Protocol* which is referenced in the command line section for editing the server.xml.

 

Reference Doc: https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/running-jira-applications-over-ssl-or-https-861253906.html
fields.summary: Jira SSL documentation requiring update

fields.description: The reasoning behind why I do not want to use the epics panel for this application is because I do not feel it allows for easy backlog prioritization due to its tiered nature. The tiered nature gives the sense that they are two separate backlogs with two separate priorities.
fields.summary: As a project manager, I want to see the 'issues in epic' in the details panel, similar to the way that 'linked issues' are viewable in the details panel (right panel).

fields.description:
There are companies that manage their releases by merging the code into specific branches. For example: there is  a "staging" branch for code that is currently in test, and a "production" branch for code that is stable and live.

Expected: 
*to have a trigger for when a commit gets made to a specific branch.*

Actual: 
There is a trigger to transition on commits, but it does not allow on specific branches.
fields.summary: Workflow trigger: commit on specific branch

fields.description:
On Backlog screen board, the component id="ghx-controls-filters" stay over the component id="ghx-backlog-search" when using this searching box

as the search box is used, a close button appears to delete the search, but not clikeable because the other html component stay over.
fields.summary: BUG :: "QUICK FILTERS" tag goes over "SEARCH BOX" and do not let close button to be clicked

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The information about pull requests, commits, etc. that is present in the *development* panel is not shown in the search results list view when connecting a repository already having a lot of issue keys to sync.

Because of this change of behaviour, it is not possible to run the below advanced searches and to know which issue has what in the *development* panel:
{noformat}
development[pullrequests]
development[commits]
development[reviews]
development[builds]
{noformat}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect JIRA to a repository (BitBucket or Github) having a lot of issues mentioned in the commits. 
 # Wait for the sync to finish
 # Run a search for all the issue having something in the *development* panel. E.g.:
 {{development[pullrequests].all >0 OR development[commits].all > 0 OR development[reviews].all > 0 OR development[builds].failing > 0}}

h3. Expected Results

A list of issues is returned and by showing the *Development* column in the search results list view you can see the development status for all of them.
h3. Actual Results

No issues are returned.

However, if you open an issue that you know it has some information in the development panel then the information is retrieved and at the successive search the issue is returned in the results.

This behavior is also described in the below 2 thread on communities:
 - [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/JIRA-questions/JQL-quot-issue-property-development-commits-gt-0-quot-not/qaq-p/298377]
 - [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Answers-Developer-Questions/Get-commits-info-of-a-JIRA-issue-using-REST-API/qaq-p/530323]

{quote}In certain cases, changes in Stash will not be updated in JIRA unless you manually view the issue or view it as part of release hub [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Checking+the+progress+of+a+version].
 These cases are:
 - When JIRA is down or unreachable
 - When a repository is pushed to Stash with a lot of issues mentioned in the commits{quote}
 
h3. Notes
Because of JSWCLOUD-16143 the *development* info may be missing from the search results even after applying the workaround (the issues having development related infos are now found by the search, but the field shows as empty in the list view).

h3. Workaround

You can ask support to provide a list of all the issueIds for your instance and then run a script that calls the below endpoint for each issueID:
 - [https://INSTANCE/rest/dev-status/1.0/issue/summary?issueId=ISSUE-ID|https://instance/rest/dev-status/1.0/issue/summary?issueId=ISSUE-ID]

E.g.
{noformat}
#!/bin/bash
while read line
 do 

curl -u <e-mail>:<api_token> -H "Accept: application/json" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X GET "https://<INSTANCE_URL>/rest/dev-status/1.0/issue/summary?issueId=$line"

echo -e "\n"

sleep .5

done < file_with_issues_ids.txt
{noformat}
fields.summary: The Development field information is not searchable when connecting a repository with a lot of issue keys

fields.description:
I was trying to perform a bulk change in some issues on my backlog. When I was on the "Bulk Operation Progress", the page didn't' showed any progress. Since that, every bulk change that I tryed to do went to the same page that shows no progress (progress of the first mentioned bulk change). There is some bug or malfunction on the JIRA? What I can do in this case? There is some way to cancel this bulk change?

 

!image-2017-07-31-18-12-28-431.png!
fields.summary: "Bulk Operation Progress" screen don't show any progress on my changes since Friday (28/07)!

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to access boards; error is shown as below:

!Oops.error.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Navigate to any boards on the instance
h3. Expected Results

Boards displayed correctly without any issue
h3. Actual Results
 # Page keeps on loading or on some cases it showing *Oops, something went wrong* error, or
 # The Boards page displays as blank with the rotating circle (indicating that it's waiting for data).

h3. Notes

Please raise a ticket to [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/]

The following info may be useful for developers
{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unique SelectableField not found for id 'customfield_10000'.
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.vsearch.SelectableFieldRegistryImpl.lambda$getSelectableField$0(SelectableFieldRegistryImpl.java:89)
	at java.util.Optional.orElseThrow(Optional.java:290)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.vsearch.SelectableFieldRegistryImpl.getSelectableField(SelectableFieldRegistryImpl.java:89)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor663.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.util.ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.java:26)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy723.getSelectableField(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor663.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:302)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.doInvoke(ServiceInvoker.java:56)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:60)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:133)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:121)
{noformat}
{noformat}
Custom field searcher module: com.atlassian.jconnect.jconnect-plugin:location-searcher is invalid. Null being returned.
{noformat}


h3. Workaround

# Turn off "Days in column" for the broken boards. This will fix the board, but agile reports for them will still be broken:
 !days-in-column.png|thumbnail! 
# If this is not an option, as written in the "Notes" section, please raise a ticket to [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/] to have a workaround for this issue applied.
fields.summary: Unable to access boards

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a workflow is simplified, the transition name is changed to an older value.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* JIRA Software Application - 1000.0.1-D20170630T012024

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy an existing workflow scheme used by a board.
# Edit a transition name, eg: _Done_ to _Resolve_ for the copied workflow.
# Associate the workflow scheme to the project where it was previously copied from.
# Simplify the workflow in the Board Configuration

h3. Expected Results
The transition name remains as _Resolve_
h3. Actual Results
The transition name changes back to _Done_

h3.Workaround
No workarounds at the moment.
fields.summary: Transition name changes after simplifying workflow.
conformation message is not displayed while we creating potential

fields.description:
*THIS IS A BUG NOT A SUGGESTION - I'm not allowed to create bugs!!!!*

When clicking into the search issue field in the header the dropdown suggestion box shows on the left side of the page and gets stuck to it (see attachment search_box_left.jpg).
 

The issue is reproducible every time but also only happens in IE 11
 Version: 11.0.9600.18738
 Update versions: 11.0.44 (KB4025252)
fields.summary: [BUG] Search Suggestions Field - wrong placement

fields.description:
h3. Summary:

The find option (Command + F on MAC) doesn't work properly on cards JIRA Software Boards on Chrome.
h3. Steps to reproduce:
 * Navigate to a JIRA Software Board (Kanban or Scrum)
 * Add a sprint and some issues to this sprint
 * Navigate to the *Active Sprints*
 * Try to use the find option (Command F) to search for any issues
 * *However, if you search for the complete issue key (e.g TP-23)*
 * Please, check the video attached to check more details about the issue

h3. Expected Results

The issue should appear on the find bar and would be highlighted.
h3. Actual Results

The issue does not appear in the bar and it is not highlighted.
h3. Workaround
 * If you search only for the project prefix, you will find many issues.
 * If you search only for the issue ID (*e.g. 23*), you will find the issue you want.
fields.summary: Find option on board cards doesn't work for Issue Key

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The information about pull requests, commits, etc. that is present in the *development* panel is not shown in the search results list view anymore.

Since this change of behaviour, it is not possible to run the below advanced searches and see the development information for the issues returned by the search without having to open them one by one:
{noformat}
development[pullrequests] 
development[commits] 
development[reviews] 
development[builds] 
{noformat}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run a search for all the issue having something in the *development* panel. E.g.:
 {{development[pullrequests].all >0 OR development[commits].all > 0 OR development[reviews].all > 0 OR development[builds].failing > 0}}

h3. Expected Results

A list of issues is returned and by showing the *development* column in the search results list view you can see the development info for all of them (without having to open them one by one).

This was working fine before.
h3. Actual Results

The *development* column is empty for all the returned issues: 
 !dev-field-empty.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

No workaround available at the moment.
fields.summary: The Development field information is not showing in the search results (list view) anymore

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Agile Kanban/SCRUM boards are not loading in some instances. In browser console, there is an error shown about unterminated string literal in bigpipe.js

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to JIRA Software Project
# Click on Kanban Board

h3. Expected Results
The board will be shown successfully

h3. Actual Results
The board cannot be shown. Instead, there will be spinning icon that continuously spins.
Error on Console
{code}com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-plugins-webresource-plugin:bigpipe-js.js:3 Error while parsing html: SyntaxError: Invalid or unexpected token{code}

h3. Workaround
Contact Atlassian Support
fields.summary: JIRA Agile Kanban/SCRUM boards are not loading
trenix

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Quick filters in Kanban boards are appearing twice when there are too many quick filters and 'expand all swimlanes' option is selected 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to: Kanban Board
# Go to Board Settings >  Quick Filters
# Create many quick filters in the board (in my testing instance, I created 17 quick filters that took up the entire screen)
# Go back to board
# Click on ... > Expand All Swimlanes

h3. Expected Results
There should be only a single line showing the filters.

h3. Actual Results
Two quick filter bars are appearing. 

h3.Workaround
Refresh the page will make the quick filter shown as a single line back. However, if after that, the user goes back to board settings and go back to the board and select Expand All Swimlanes again, the quick filters will be shown as two bars
fields.summary: Quick Filters appearing twice in Kanban boards when there are too many quick filters and 'expand all swimlanes' are selected

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Boards columns configuration disappear and the board can't be loaded.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access any board Active Sprint or Backlog view.

h3. Expected Results
The board should load fine.

h3. Actual Results
Boards load infinitely and an error 500 like the following is logged in the browser console:
{code}
GET https://example.atlassian.net/rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/work/allData.json?rapidViewId=1&selectedProjectKey=KEY&_=1500557075479 500 ()
{code}
The following may also appear:
{code}
/rest/api/2/user/properties/user_property_key_react_filter_panel_disabled?username=?!?&_=1500999436903 Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 ()
/rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/plan/backlog/data.json?rapidViewId=4&selectedProjectKey=!?!?&_=1500999436951 Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 500 ()
{code}

Error
{code}
msg: The project <ID> is not simplified.	
	message: Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: The project <ID> is not simplified.	

stack: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The project <ID> is not simplified.
	at com.atlassian.jira.simplified.projectconfiguration.SimplifiedProjectConfigurationServiceImpl.validateProject(SimplifiedProjectConfigurationServiceImpl.java:83)
	at com.atlassian.jira.simplified.projectconfiguration.SimplifiedProjectConfigurationServiceImpl.getAccessLevelForProject(SimplifiedProjectConfigurationServiceImpl.java:46)
{code}

h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
Create the mapping of status to columns from scratch in every affected board.
fields.summary: Boards not loading error 500

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Epic issue type is counted in the issue counting of Kanban boards, even when the board is set to use Epic Swimlanes.
This can cause misleading issue count, specially if the user have several Epics in the same column.
Example:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Suggested Solution
When selected Epic Swimlane, consider not counting the Epic issue type in the columns.

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Kanban boards should not count the issue Epic when using Epic Swimlanes.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It is possible to complete a Sprint that has incomplete issues without moving them to the Backlog or new Sprint

h3. Environment
JIRA v1000.1131.0 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create *Board A* > use a filter like {code}project = VRT ORDER BY Rank ASC{code}
# Create *Sprint 1* on this board
# Create issues of type Story and type Bug > add the issues to the Sprint > Start the Sprint
# Create *Board B* > use a filter like {code} project = VRT AND issuetype in (Bug, Epic, Task) ORDER BY Rank ASC{code}
# Note that the *Sprint 1* is also showing on *Board B*
# Complete the *Sprint 1* from *Board B*


h3. Expected Results
There is a warning that not all issues from the Sprint will be moved to the next Sprint/Backlog

h3. Actual Results
The Sprint is completed. The issues of type Bug are moved to the next Sprint. However, the issues of type Sprint are not completed and not moved to the new Sprint. 
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
-
fields.summary: It is possible to complete a Sprint that has incomplete issues without moving them to the Backlog or new Sprint

fields.description: Different teams usually have different workflows thus more than one workflow should be supported within a project (on a board level). This will make Jira more scalable
fields.summary: As an administrator, I want to allow workflows on a board level instead of a project level.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it's not possible to switch to the previous Quick Filters when the New JIRA Experience is enabled without turning off the new design.

h3. Suggested Solution

Make it possible to use the Quick filters with the previous design in the New JIRA Experience.

h3. Why this is important

Some users may find the previous Quick Filters faster and more user-friendly.
 
h3. Workaround 

Turn off the New JIRA Experience in the user's profile.
fields.summary: Ability to switch the Quick Filters to its previous design

The logo is not showing up on our JIRA instance

https://theworkinggroup.atlassian.net/ 

(See attached image) !JIRA icon not appearing.png!

fields.description:
As using email handler imports coming from external customers, we can not make sure that they don´t use any special characters like smileys. 

All those mails get lost and never find their way into our JIRA.

Could you please make proceeding of special characters available?

If there is a workaround - please let me know as well.

 

Here a snippet from the logging file including the {color:#FF0000}smiley{color}:

Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:Issue][summary,Fw: Fehler A
rtikelbeschreibung *{color:#FF0000}<U+1F609>{color}*] .....

 

Best, 

Katharina
fields.summary: E-Mail Handler should work with special characters

fields.description:
h3. Summary

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# go to the Kanban board and set a quickfilter (example "Only My Issues")
# open one of the issues by clicking it in the Kanban board
# you'll be redirected to the issue, and you should be able to see kanban board button on the left side
# click on the button

h3. Expected Results
* Redirected to Kanban Board with previously selected quick filter still selected

h3. Actual Results
* The quick filter is no longer selected

h3.Workaround
Instead of clicking on the "Kanban Board" button on the lift, user can click on "Boards"
 dropdown button on top of the page, and the user should be able to see the recently accessed board and click on it to be redirected to Board, and the quick filter will still be selected. Or the user can also click "Back" or "Previous" in the browser itself.
fields.summary: Quick Filter Cleared When Accessing Kanban Board Through the "Kanban Board" Button on Sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"View unmapped statuses which contain these issues." doesn't link to Columns Configuration on the board

h3. Environment
Atlassian Cloud
JIRA v1000.1119.0


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Board
# Go to *Board Settings* > *Columns*
# Unmap a status from a column 
# Check the *General* configuration for the board

*  !general configuration for the board.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The link goes to *Board Settings* > *Columns* 

h3. Actual Results
The link goes to the Board backlog / Kanban Board 
 

h3.Workaround
Navigate to the *Board Settings* > *Columns*
fields.summary: "View unmapped statuses which contain these issues." doesn't link to the Columns Configuration on the board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the *Version* or *Epic* side panel is activated, the issue navigation skips from one issue to another when scrolling with the *_J_* and _*K*_ shortcut key. This happens in both list view and detailed view.

_*Video Link Provided To View Bug:*_ 
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the Backlog for the Project Board
 # Click on the Versions or Epics side panel and choose a specific version or epic
 # Click on the issue and start scrolling with the J and K key
 # As you scroll you will notice that the issue highlight disappears and the issue that can be viewed in the detailed view is not within the version or epic.
 # The highlight reappears back again on the issue after going through issues which are not categorized in the specified version or epic.

h3. Expected Results

To be able to scroll with the J and K key through the issue navigator panel one by one for the specified version or epic.
h3. Actual Results

The issue skips and jumps from one issue to another not within the specified version or epic.
h3. Workaround

No workaround as of now as it seems to be user interface related bug.
fields.summary: Issues are skipped when scrolling with "J" and "K" key in Scrum Board View with Panels Activated

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the *Kanban Board view*, the header that shows the status of the issue gets detached when scrolling down. This happens for both detailed view and default view. Only seems to affect Google Chrome browser. 

_*Video Link Provided To View Bug*_
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 * Chrome (Version 59.0.3071.115 (Official Build) (64-bit))

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the Kanban Board of a project
 # Make sure to have a list of issues to scroll down
 # Start scrolling down through the issues and you will notice the header with statuses getting detached and following down randomly

h3. Expected Results

To be able to scroll down without the header getting detached and scrolling together randomly
h3. Actual Results

The header gets detached and starts moving randomly when scrolling down
h3. Workaround

Workaround would be to use a different browser for now as this issue does not occur in FireFox or Safari.
fields.summary: Kanban Board header keeps getting detached and moves below disturbing the view when scrolling

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using Safari, I am unable to see All Boards.

Tested on Safari versions:

- 9.1.2
- 9.1.3

h3. Affected Versions

- JIRA v1000.1126.0
- JIRA v1001.0.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Open JIRA
# Navigate through Boards > View All Boards
https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/ManageRapidViews.jspa

h3. Expected Results

See all boards.

h3. Actual Results

Any board is shown.

 !Screen Shot 2017-07-18 at 4.47.38 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

- Update Safari version to 10.0.1
- Use another browser
fields.summary: Using Safari, boards don't load

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, subtasks can be moved up/down one by one. The customer would want to be able to move multiple subtasks at once
 !up and down.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add possibility to move multiple subtasks Up/Down under parent view
fields.summary: Add possibility to move multiple subtasks Up/Down under parent view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Burndown Chart report doesn't load when board filter is set as:
"issuetype in standardIssueTypes()"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new board
# Create a filter using the following JQL:
{code}issuetype in standardIssueTypes(){code}
# Set the newly created filter on the board
# Go to the board -> Reports -> Burndown Chart

h3. Expected Results
The report is properly shown

h3. Actual Results
The following error is thrown:
{quote}
*Error*
Compound clauses must contain at least 2 subClauses
{quote}

Logs:
{code}
ERROR 557058:77a7d150-cf4e-4b6c-9a7b-c80c207b4301 766x13398x1  201.22.212.136 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapid/charts/scopechangeburndownchart.json [c.a.g.w.r.chart.RapidChartResource.privacy-safe] Unable to complete GreenHopper REST method 
2017-07-17 12:46:59.371021500 com.atlassian.jira.log.clean.PrivacySafeException: Privacy-safe boxing of a java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
2017-07-17 12:46:59.371022500 	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.query.QueryAnonymizer$VisitorWithParentheses.dealWithCompoundClause(QueryAnonymizer.java:338)
2017-07-17 12:46:59.371052500 	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.query.QueryAnonymizer$VisitorWithParentheses.visit(QueryAnonymizer.java:259)
2017-07-17 12:46:59.371053500 	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.query.QueryAnonymizer$VisitorWithParentheses.visit(QueryAnonymizer.java:253)
2017-07-17 12:46:59.371053500 	at com.atlassian.query.clause.AndClause.accept(AndClause.java:28)
2017-07-17 12:46:59.371053500 	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.query.QueryAnonymizer.processClause(QueryAnonymizer.java:108)
2017-07-17 12:46:59.371058500 	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.query.QueryAnonymizer.processQuery(QueryAnonymizer.java:80)
2017-07-17 12:46:59.371058500 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.dualsearch.DualSearcher$LogBuilder.prepareJqlStringForInstrumentation(DualSearcher.java:296)
2017-07-17 12:46:59.371063500 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.dualsearch.DualSearcher$LogBuilder.logQuery(DualSearcher.java:251)
2017-07-17 12:46:59.371063500 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.SprintHistoryServiceDualSearchImpl.findSprintHistory(SprintHistoryServiceDualSearchImpl.java:70)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Version release doesn't work if there's another version with the same name

h3. Environment
* JIRA v1000.1119.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a version with name 'version 1'
# Try releasing the version created on step 1 and it should work
# Create a version with name 'version 1 '
# Try releasing the version created on step 3 and nothing will happen

h3. Expected Results
Version is released 

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens
 
h3. Notes
* 

h3.Workaround
* Rename the version
fields.summary: Unable release version if the name is duplicated

fields.description: In the List View Filter allow a column to display the Most Recent Comment, as was allowed in V6. This request is similar, but not the same as JSWCLOUD-12220 (for the Card Layout)
fields.summary: List View Filter: ADD option to display "most recent comment" back

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Text is overlapping in JIRA Software Boards new UI.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JIRA SW board with the new UI.
# Put a large text in summary of the issue.
# Select the issue.

h3. Expected Results
The summary should be presented until the issue key appears.

h3. Actual Results
The results are the ones shown in the screenshot.
The issue key overlaps the summary of the issue.
 
h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Text overlapping in JIRA Software Boards new UI

fields.description:
According to [Using your Scrum backlog|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/using-your-scrum-backlog-764478062.html], the search button can search for an issue by name, code, or assignee.

It would be great to improve this feature to also allow our customers to search for other fields such as priority, reporter, labels, epic, etc.
fields.summary: Improve the scrum/kanban board backlog search button.

fields.description:
!image-2017-07-17-13-58-05-679.png!

As shown on above screenshot, if user switches views of a scrum board between backlog view and active sprint view, there is possibility to reproduce the bug shown above. there is an odd "QUICK FILTERS" appears. Refresh the page may eliminate the odd filter bar.
fields.summary: Odd "QUICK FILTER" bar on JIRA Backlog / Active spring UI

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you edit the 'Epic Link' on a software issue, you get 2 entries in the change history for this operation and 2 issue_updated events fire

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit the 'Epic Link' in a JIRA Issue 
# Check the issue history

h3. Expected Results
There is one entry in the issue history. 

h3. Actual Results
There are two entries in the issue history.  
!Edit Epic 2 events in History.jpg|thumbnail! 


h3. Notes
You can also install the 'Connect inspector' from https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/developing/frameworks-and-tools.html and check the duplicate events on edit.

This is quite likely to impact customers who have automations / add-ons which relies on the events in the issue history.
fields.summary: Editing 'Epic Link' on an issue creates 2 change history entries and fires 2 'issue_updated' events

fields.description: The QUICK FILTER seems to be rendering twice. Both are functional, but the second one is overlapped with other text.  A screenshot of our team's filters is attached.
fields.summary: Quick Filters appears duplicated

fields.description: When using a Kanban board, users want to be able to right click on a card and choose an option to have it sent to the backlog.
fields.summary: As an admin I want to be able to send an issue to backlog when right clicking on Kanban Card

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Quick Filters in Software boards are appearing twice and overlapped in the board.
h3. Environment

Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the board
 # Go to: Active Sprints
 # Check the quick filters

h3. Expected Results

There should be only a single line showing the filters.
h3. Actual Results

Two quick filter bars are appearing and they are sometimes overlapping.
 !quickfilters.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Force refresh the board's page. In Firefox, you can do it pressing Ctrl+F5. In Chrome, you can force refresh the page pressing Ctrl+F5 or Shift+F5.
fields.summary: Quick Filters bar appearing twice in JIRA Software boards

fields.description:
Hi,

In my instance 2spark.atlassian.net could you change the user of Johanna Remus from camille.deau to johanna.remus

thanks a lot, Anne
fields.summary: Could you change user key in jira cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The new search field for filters is not working as well as the Assignee filter

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access any board of the site.
# Try to search for a filter on the search field.

h3. Expected Results
Filters should be returned.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens and one of the following exceptions is logged on the browser console:
{noformat}
Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: GH.bridge.FilterBridge.reset is not a function
    at initFiltersBridge (batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&filter_panel…:26345)
    at batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&filter_panel…:26338
    at <anonymous>
{noformat}

{noformat}
Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: GH.bridge.FilterBridge.reset is not a function
    at loadFilterPanelInitialData (batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&filter_panel…:33333)
    at batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&filter_panel…:33194
    at j (batch.js?locale=en-US:76)
    at Object.add [as done] (batch.js?locale=en-US:76)
    at initFiltersBridge (batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&filter_panel…:33193)
    at batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&filter_panel…:32113
    at <anonymous>
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
fields.summary: New filter bar is not working.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, the Done column in the Active Sprints is fixed on the board. It is not possible to hide the done column to reduce clutter.

h3. Suggested Solution

Enable a feature to toggle the visibility of the Done Column in the Active sprint.

h3. Why this is important
 
There are use cases where the visibility of the Done column is not required on the Active Sprints. ie. there are multiple columns in the board and developers are not really interested to see what is on the Done Column.
fields.summary: Allow toggling of the visibility for the Done column in Active sprints
